commits.message:
Test upgrade between patch versions
- e.g. from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1

Various fixes to the "Upgrade" GitHub Action, including:
- install strictly confined microk8s snap
- include charm-base in CAAS registry
- don't install wait-for plugin in 3.0
- don't use snap for upgrade
- combine upgrade steps
- fail early if no upgrades available
- replace deprecated set-output with $GITHUB_OUTPUT

Merge pull request #14847 from barrettj12/upgrade3

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14847

Various fixes to the "Upgrade" GitHub Action, including:
- install strictly confined microk8s snap
- include charm-base in CAAS registry
- don't install wait-for plugin in 3.0
- don't use snap for upgrade
- combine upgrade steps
- fail early if no upgrades available

Upgrading from 2.9 to 3.0 is not allowed, so we should not be testing this upgrade. Instead, test upgrade from the previous stable patch version, e.g. 3.0.0 -> 3.0.1.

In future, we should introduce a GitHub Action to test model migrations from 2.9 -> 3.0.

pull_request.title: Test upgrade between patch versions, e.g. from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1
pull_request.body:
Various fixes to the "Upgrade" GitHub Action, including:
- install strictly confined microk8s snap
- include charm-base in CAAS registry
- don't install wait-for plugin in 3.0
- don't use snap for upgrade
- combine upgrade steps
- fail early if no upgrades available

Upgrading from 2.9 to 3.0 is not allowed, so we should not be testing this upgrade. Instead, test upgrade from the previous stable patch version, e.g. 3.0.0 -> 3.0.1.

In future, we should introduce a GitHub Action to test model migrations from 2.9 -> 3.0.

commits.message:
Upgrades juju/workers to v3.1.0

We are updating to the latest worker package to get support for
errors.Is and errors.As. This allows Juju worker code the ability to
wrap more errors and not have to worry that the cause being produced by
the worker package will be misunderstood.

Merge pull request #14851 from tlm/upgrade-worker-package

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14851

We are updating to the latest worker package to get support for errors.Is and errors.As. This allows Juju worker code the ability to wrap more errors and not have to worry that the cause being produced by the worker package will be misunderstood.

- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made

## QA steps

For testing this we are going to rely on our standard test suites. Juju has already been updated to this package internally.

repo.name: juju
repo.description: Universal Operator Lifecycle Manager (OLM) for Kubernetes operators, and operators for traditional Linux apps, with declarative integration between operators for automated microservice integration.

commits.message:
Remove unused WatchAllContainers.

Due to unconverted-api-worker refactor into workers using manifolds,
WatchAllContainers is no longer used by the provisioner.

APIWorkersManifold renamed and repurposed to MachineStartupManifold

A step in refactoring the unconverted-api-workers into pieces using
individual manifolds. MachineStartup will handle machine setup necessary
but requiring an API Connection. The actual work is part of the machine
agent and will be done via a config method.

Create ContainerProvisioningManifold and ContainerWorker

A step in refactoring the unconverted-api-worker manifold into
individual pieces. These will hold a container provisioner based on
container type.

Update IAAS machine manifolds to remove unconverted-api-worker.

The unconverted-api-worker is being split into three pieces. machine-setup is short lived and does setup on the machine which required an API Connection. The other two are container provisioner workers for lxd and kvm.

The functionality of the container-watcher for setup is placed into the container provisioner worker. It waits for a container to be provisioned, configures the container system on the machine and starts an container provisioner worker.

Do no assume container support cannot change.

Always verify LXD and KVM in setupContainerSupport.

Name changes and unit tests.

Renamed ContainerWorker to containerSetupAndProvisioner for understandability. Updated unit tests for container setup.

minor updates.

Change Report() results to make tests easier. Remove unused code from
unit tests. Change capitalization of ContainerSetupAndProvisioner.
Add unit tests for ContainerSetupAndProvisioner

Implement unit tests for container manifold.

Changes to code to faciliate mocks, including adding a couple of
interfaces and a shim. Moved code out of start to a new method for same.
This can be resolved once we have good mocking in this package.
Resolve linter reported error, check returned error.

Improve error messages.

Use errors.Is rather than deprecated methods and update very old style
messages.
Improve wording of comments, log notes and variables

Fix: TestMachineWorkers

The kvm-container-provisioner is only running on hardware which supports kvm. Thus the test is hardware dependent and gives different results. Allow for this by specifying  optional workers.

Startup of kvm-container-provisioner is tested in the provisioner worker.

WatchAllContainers removed from mock. No longer used with refactor
of unconverted-api-workers to manifold workers.

Merge pull request #14834 from hmlanigan/kill-unconverted-api-workers-2-9

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14834

Split the unconverted-api-workers into two new workers and remove.

machine-setup runs setup on machines which require an API Connection. Once setup is done it can be uninstalled.

kvm-container-provisioner and lxd-container-provisioner both wait for a machine of their container type to be provisioned if the machine supports their container type. If it doesn't, the worker uninstalls. The first container provisioned of their type will cause setup for the container systems to run, then a container provisioner is started.

## QA steps

```sh
$ juju bootstrap openstack dot --constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju bootstrap openstack src --constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju add-model move-me 
$ juju set-model-constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju add-machine lxd
$ juju add-machine kvm
$ juju add-machine 
$ juju remove-machine 0/lxd/0
$ juju add-machine lxd:0

# once settled
$ juju migrate move-me dst
$ juju switch dst:move-me

$ juju add-machine lxd:1

# checkout the juju_engine_report on each. The kvm-container-provisioner and lxd-container-provisioner have reports on whether the container watchers are still running and if the provisioners are running. 
```

## Bug reference

https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1994488
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1983140

pull_request.title: [JUJU-2030]Kill unconverted api workers 2 9
pull_request.body:
Split the unconverted-api-workers into two new workers and remove.

machine-setup runs setup on machines which require an API Connection. Once setup is done it can be uninstalled.

kvm-container-provisioner and lxd-container-provisioner both wait for a machine of their container type to be provisioned if the machine supports their container type. If it doesn't, the worker uninstalls. The first container provisioned of their type will cause setup for the container systems to run, then a container provisioner is started.

## QA steps

```sh
$ juju bootstrap openstack dot --constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju bootstrap openstack src --constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju add-model move-me 
$ juju set-model-constraints allocate-public-ip=true
$ juju add-machine lxd
$ juju add-machine kvm
$ juju add-machine 
$ juju remove-machine 0/lxd/0
$ juju add-machine lxd:0

# once settled
$ juju migrate move-me dst
$ juju switch dst:move-me

$ juju add-machine lxd:1

# checkout the juju_engine_report on each.  The kvm-container-provisioner and lxd-container-provisioner have reports on whether the container watchers are still running and if the provisioners are running. 
```

## Bug reference

https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1994488
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1983140

Merge pull request #14838 from wallyworld/strict-k8s-config

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14838

When running inside the strict snap, the user's real home is set by the SNAP_REAL_HOME env var. We need to alter the k8s kube config loading rules to also look here to load the usual `~/.kube/config` file.

Also, strict snaps cannot access external cloud tools like `eksctl` etc. So we need to disable the `--gke'` `--aks` and `--eks` helpers on `add-k8s` for now.

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made

- ~[ ] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

I compiled a strict snap and ran `juju add-k8s --client`

https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1994162

commits.message: Fix dashboard not found error msg

Merge pull request #14849 from barrettj12/dashboard-ux

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14849

The `juju dashboard` command was displaying an unfriendly error when the dashboard was not deployed/available:
```
$ juju dashboard
ERROR getting dashboard address for controller "foo": dashboard address in relation data not found
```

The error returned from the API client was not being converted to a `juju/errors` error. We just need to use the `params.TranslateWellKnownError` function to convert this to an error that we can pattern match against.

## QA steps

```console
$ juju bootstrap lxd c
$ juju dashboard
The Juju dashboard is not yet deployed.
To deploy the Juju dashboard, follow these steps:
 juju switch controller
 juju deploy juju-dashboard
 juju expose juju-dashboard
 juju relate juju-dashboard controller
```

## Bug reference
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1994953

pull_request.title: Fix dashboard not found error msg
pull_request.body:
The `juju dashboard` command was displaying an unfriendly error when the dashboard was not deployed/available:
```
$ juju dashboard
ERROR getting dashboard address for controller "foo": dashboard address in relation data not found
```

The error returned from the API client was not being converted to a `juju/errors` error. We just need to use the `params.TranslateWellKnownError` function to convert this to an error that we can pattern match against.

## QA steps

```console
$ juju bootstrap lxd c
$ juju dashboard
The Juju dashboard is not yet deployed.
To deploy the Juju dashboard, follow these steps:
  juju switch controller
  juju deploy juju-dashboard
  juju expose juju-dashboard
  juju relate juju-dashboard controller
```

## Bug reference
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1994953

commits.message:
avoid microk8s permission check when bootstrapping lxd

change the signature of CloudDetector DetectCloud behaviour to false so that the caller knows to skip that cloud.
guard for non-microk8s cloud if error is a permission issue and return errors.NotFound so caller can know to skip

Merge pull request #14810 from basebandit/avoid_microk8s_check_when_bootstrapping_lxd

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14810

When bootstrapping an LXD controller and the current `jenkins` is not a member of the microk8s group, the bootstrap fails due to this. This PR adds a check for non-microk8s cloud in the `k8s` provider's `CloudDetector` implementation (which is responsible for checking for microk8s permission) to avoid returning an error if the cloud we are bootstrapping is a non-microk8s cloud, i.e when boostrapping an LXD controller. 
NOTE: This error is intermittent, it might take you a couple of tries before you reproduce it. 

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- ~[ ] Comments saying why design decisions were made~
- ~[ ] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

```sh
sudo deluser jenkins microk8s
su - jenkins
juju bootstrap localhost
```
You should be able to bootstrap a lxd controller, even if you are not a microk8s group member.
All relevant unit tests should pass

## Bug reference

https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1937985

pull_request.title: [JUJU-2024] avoid microk8s permission check when bootstrapping lxd
pull_request.body:
When bootstrapping an LXD controller and the current `$USER` is not a member of the microk8s group, the bootstrap  fails due to this. This PR adds a check for non-microk8s cloud in the `k8s` provider's  `CloudDetector` implementation (which is responsible for checking for microk8s permission)  to avoid returning an error if the cloud we are bootstrapping is a non-microk8s cloud, i.e when boostrapping an LXD controller. 
NOTE: This error is intermittent, it might take you a couple of tries before you reproduce it. 

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- ~[ ] Comments saying why design decisions were made~
- ~[ ] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

```sh
sudo deluser $USER microk8s
su - $USER
juju bootstrap localhost
```
You should be able to bootstrap a lxd controller, even if you are not a microk8s group member.
All relevant unit tests should pass

## Bug reference

https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1937985

commits.message: [smoke test] remove snap

Merge pull request #14837 from barrettj12/smoke-snap

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14837

Smoke tests are supposed to run quickly and reveal any major issues introduced. Currently, they take 15-20 mins to run, because they have to build and install the snap first.

However, we already have a Snapcraft test to check that the snap works. Hence, we can remove the snapcraft step from the smoke tests. We replace this with a build step, which will build a local Juju that we can test instead.

## QA steps

Check that "Smoke" Github action passes below.

pull_request.title: [smoke tests] remove snap

Smoke tests are supposed to run quickly and reveal any major issues introduced. Currently, they take 15-20 mins to run, because they have to build and install the snap first.

issue.title: Change grep pregex to regex
issue.body:
User noted that grep -P flag breaks compiling on macOS. Tested without the -P flag and the command `grep "^go"` works without the -P flag. Do not have MacOS so - would like someone with MacOS to test to see if that solves that issue. 

*Why this change is needed and what it does.*

## Checklist

*If an item is not applicable, use `~strikethrough~`.*

- ~[ ] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc~
- ~[ ] Comments saying why design decisions were made~
- ~[ ] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

*Commands to run to verify that the change works.*

Change to a version of go that's not supported by go.mod and run "make install-dependencies"

If you get the message 

> required go version '1.19'

with the correct version in between the single quotes then it is parsing go.mod properly. 

```sh
$ sudo snap refresh go --channel=1.18/stable --classic
go (1.18/stable) 1.18.7 from Michael Hudson-Doyle (mwhudson) refreshed
$ make install-dependencies
Makefile:351: "warning: version of go too low: use 'snap refresh go --channel=1.19'"
Makefile:352: *** "error Installed go version '1.18.7' less than required go version '1.19'".  Stop.``````

@hpidcock @anvial @juanmanuel-tirado

*Commands to run to verify that the change works.*

Change to a version of go that's not supported by go.mod and run "make install-dependencies"

If you get the message 

> required go version '1.19'

with the correct version in between the single quotes then it is parsing go.mod properly. 

```sh
$ sudo snap refresh go --channel=1.18/stable --classic
go (1.18/stable) 1.18.7 from Michael Hudson-Doyle (mwhudson) refreshed
$ make install-dependencies
Makefile:351: "warning: version of go too low: use 'snap refresh go --channel=1.19'"
Makefile:352: *** "error Installed go version '1.18.7' less than required go version '1.19'".  Stop.``````

```

commits.message: Fix issue with unit agent looping after secret remove

Merge pull request #14840 from wallyworld/fix-secret-remove

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14840

When removing a secret, the unit agent's snapshot of remote state was not being updated after the completion of processing, so that the resolver was continuously triggered to handle the deletion. We add a commit handler to the secret deletion operation to remove the deleted secrets from the watcher emote state.

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made
- [x] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing
- ~[ ] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~

$ juju exec --unit controller/0 -- "secret-add foo=bar"
secret:cdddcfsfudkjil03ctcg
$ juju exec --unit controller/0 -- "secret-get cdddcfsfudkjil03ctcg"
foo: bar
$ juju exec --unit controller/0 -- "secret-remove cdddcfsfudkjil03ctcg
```

repeat the above

commits.message: Account for altered home in strict snap when loading kube config

Merge pull request #14838 from wallyworld/strict-k8s-config

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14838

When running inside the strict snap, the user's real home is set by the SNAP_REAL_HOME env var. We need to alter the k8s kube config loading rules to also look here to load the usual `~/.kube/config` file.

Also, strict snaps cannot access external cloud tools like `eksctl` etc. So we need to disable the `--gke'` `--aks` and `--eks` helpers on `add-k8s` for now.

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made
- [x] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing
- ~[ ] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
- ~[ ] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

I compiled a strict snap and ran `juju add-k8s --client`

## Bug reference

https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1994162

commits.message: remove single quotes around logging-config constraints
patch the charmrevisionupdate interval since the charm revision worker no longer runs on startup

Merge pull request #14767 from basebandit/JUJU-1951_fix-failing-test-model-tests

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14767

- Removes quotes around the logging-config constraints in the [test-model-metrics tests](test-model-test-model-metrics-lxd) in proving grounds.
- Overrides the charm revision updater interval to control how often the charm revision worker runs. (Sets it to 15s interval)
**NOTE:** A change introduced in the charmrevision worker loop. (Can't trace the PR) prevents the charm revision calling on startup.( For good reasons). We implemented a truncated exponential backoff with introduced jitter.

commits.message:
setup.py: adjust websockets versions for py38-310

According to the websockets changelog[0]:
  - v8.0 requires python >= 3.6
  - v8.1 adds support for python3.8
  - v9.0 adds support for python3.9
  - v10.0 adds support for python3.10

This change is attempting to cover all these scenarios. The previous
behavior was allowing some unwanted scenarios, e.g. websockets==9.0 and
python3.10 combination. Which is incompatible.

[0] https://websockets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/project/changelog.html

Closes #730

Signed-off-by: Mert Kırpıcı <mert.kirpici@canonical.com>
Merge branch 'master' into gh/730

Merge pull request #731 from mert-kirpici/gh/730

https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/731

According to the [websockets changelog](https://websockets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/project/changelog.html):
 - v8.0 requires python >= 3.6
 - v8.1 adds support for python3.8
 - v9.0 adds support for python3.9
 - v10.0 adds support for python3.10

This change is attempting to cover all these scenarios. The previous behavior was allowing some unwanted scenarios, e.g. websockets==9.0 and python3.10 combination. Which is incompatible.

Fixes: #730

issue.title: [Bug]: websockets versions not covering all python >= 3.6 correctly
issue.body:
### Description

According to the [websockets changelog](https://websockets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/project/changelog.html):
  - v8.0 requires python >= 3.6
  - v8.1 adds support for python3.8
  - v9.0 adds support for python3.9
  - v10.0 adds support for python3.10

In `setup.py` the current way that websockets versions are pinned does not cover all scenarios correctly.
An example breaking scenario that is allowed by pip featuring websockets==9.0 and python3.10(jammy) is attached in the reproduce section.

### Urgency

Casually reporting

### Python-libjuju version

3.0.1

### Juju version

2.9.34

### Reproduce / Test

```python
ubuntu@juju-ee99cd-test-libjuju-3:~/python-libjuju$ git branch -vv
* master bd01785 [origin/master] Merge pull request #725 from cderici/example-revisit-unitrun

pull_request.title: setup.py: adjust websockets versions for py38-310
pull_request.body:
According to the [websockets changelog](https://websockets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/project/changelog.html):
  - v8.0 requires python >= 3.6
  - v8.1 adds support for python3.8
  - v9.0 adds support for python3.9
  - v10.0 adds support for python3.10

This change is attempting to cover all these scenarios. The previous behavior was allowing some unwanted scenarios, e.g. websockets==9.0 and python3.10 combination. Which is incompatible.

Fixes: #730

go.mod specifies go version 1.19. Set install-dependencies to use 1.19

Previously "make install-dependencies" would try to install go 1.18 even
though go.mod specifies go version 1.19.

Makefile to check go.mod for required version

This removes the hardcoded 1.18 or 1.19 versioning in the Makefile
and replaces it with a grep for the version in go.mod instead.
Fixed series. Fixed relation names. Added comments. Used check util functions

- add a TL;DR at top to help external contributors
- improve makefile section
- describe versioned branches
Update juju/packaging to v2.0.1

Improvements to CONTRIBUTING.md
- add a TL;DR at top to help external contributors
- improve makefile section
- describe versioned branches

Show revision during "juju download" (like deploy does)

I found the lack of revision made it harder to see what was going on
when testing "juju info" and then "juju download" on a charm with
multiple channels and arches. Also, it matches how we show revision
during deploy (and deploy --dry-run).

Fix messed-up channels formatting for "juju info" of a bundle

I broke the channels formatting with the changes to "juju info" in 3.0
in PR https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14696.

This PR fixes that. What was happening was is that in the default mode
of baseModeBoth, arches and bases were coming through as "", making
the TabWriter output 4 spaces (2 for each column) at the end of the
line. This put the YAML encoder into quoted-string mode, making the
output look like this:

$ juju info charmed-kubernetes
name: charmed-kubernetes
publisher: Canonical Kubernetes
description: A highly-available, production-grade Kubernetes cluster.
bundle-id: ZZagr3kLqZpwK7OtKyRrI0MxbLnvKN0G
tags: cloud
channels: "latest/stable:     1185  2022-09-01  (1185)  5kB    \nlatest/candidate:
  \ 1188  2022-09-09  (1188)  5kB    \nlatest/beta:       1183  2022-08-28  (1183)
  \ 5kB    \nlatest/edge:       1194  2022-10-17  (1194)  5kB    \n1.26/stable:       –\n1.26/candidate:
  \   –\n1.26/beta:         –\n1.26/edge:         1195  2022-10-17  (1195)  5kB    \n1.25/stable:
  \      1186  2022-09-01  (1186)  5kB    \n1.25/candidate:    1187  2022-09-09  (1187)
  \ 5kB    \n1.25/beta:         1184  2022-08-28  (1184)  5kB    \n1.25/edge:         1182
  \ 2022-08-17  (1182)  5kB    \n1.24/stable:       1155  2022-08-04  (1155)  5kB
  \   \n1.24/candidate:    1149  2022-08-02  (1149)  5kB    \n1.24/beta:         1005
  \ 2022-05-06  (1005)  1kB    \n1.24/edge:         1179  2022-08-15  (1179)  5kB
  \   \n1.23/stable:       –\n1.23/candidate:    –\n1.23/beta:         –\n1.23/edge:
  \        942  2022-03-16  (942)  1kB    \n"

Instead of this:

$ juju info charmed-kubernetes
name: charmed-kubernetes
publisher: Canonical Kubernetes
description: A highly-available, production-grade Kubernetes cluster.
bundle-id: ZZagr3kLqZpwK7OtKyRrI0MxbLnvKN0G
tags: cloud
channels: |
  latest/stable:     1185  2022-09-01  (1185)  5kB
  latest/candidate:  1188  2022-09-09  (1188)  5kB
  latest/beta:       1183  2022-08-28  (1183)  5kB
  latest/edge:       1194  2022-10-17  (1194)  5kB
  1.26/stable:       –
  1.26/candidate:    –
  1.26/beta:         –
  1.26/edge:         1195  2022-10-17  (1195)  5kB
  1.25/stable:       1186  2022-09-01  (1186)  5kB
  1.25/candidate:    1187  2022-09-09  (1187)  5kB
  1.25/beta:         1184  2022-08-28  (1184)  5kB
  1.25/edge:         1182  2022-08-17  (1182)  5kB
  1.24/stable:       1155  2022-08-04  (1155)  5kB
  1.24/candidate:    1149  2022-08-02  (1149)  5kB
  1.24/beta:         1005  2022-05-06  (1005)  1kB
  1.24/edge:         1179  2022-08-15  (1179)  5kB
  1.23/stable:       –
  1.23/candidate:    –
  1.23/beta:         –
  1.23/edge:         942  2022-03-16  (942)  1kB

Also update the tests to actually test this case (baseModeBoth is the
default mode, not baseModeNone).

```

Merge pull request #14816 from ycliuhw/k8s-backend-support-all-revisions

Currently, we only pass the latest revision to the k8s secret provider for permission setup which means we are only able to access the secret content with the latest revision.
This PR ensures we pass all revisions.

I broke the channels formatting (for bundles only) with the changes to `juju info` in 3.0 in PR https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14696.

This PR fixes that. What was happening was is that in the default mode of `baseModeBoth`, arches and bases were coming through as `""`, making the `TabWriter` output 4 spaces (2 for each column) at the end of the line. Merge pull request #14830 from jack-w-shaw/JUJU-1952_fix_manual_deploy_integration

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14830

Most of the changes are minor bug fixes

However, there is a fairly major change from templating `~/.ssh/known_hosts` to `~/.ssh/config`, since adding hosts to know_hosts wasn't enough to ensure a controller can be bootstrapped. This isn't ideal, to be improved further when https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1994522 is resolved

go.mod specifies go version 1.19. Set install-dependencies to use 1.19

Previously "make install-dependencies" would try to install go 1.18 even
though go.mod specifies go version 1.19.

Makefile to check go.mod for required version

This removes the hardcoded 1.18 or 1.19 versioning in the Makefile
and replaces it with a grep for the version in go.mod instead.
Fixed series. Fixed relation names. Added comments. Used check util functions

Allow go versions >= than .mod go version.

Three options
1. No installed go -> install go via snap
2. go installed with a version less than .mod go -> err out
3. go installed with a version >= .mod go -> continue

Remove cut which requires coreutils

Replaced cut with awk

It should show as failed in `juju status`

```

```

And should show as unready in k8s output, but have 0 restarts and still be running.

```
NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE
simpletest-0 0/1 Running 0 3m25s
```

## Documentation changes

N/A

commits.message:
Show revision during "juju download" (like deploy does)

I found the lack of revision made it harder to see what was going on
when testing "juju info" and then "juju download" on a charm with
multiple channels and arches. Also, it matches how we show revision
during deploy (and deploy --dry-run).

Use revision number instead of sha[:7] to build default filename

Also remove the test for entity.Revision != 0. It should always be set,
and in fact 0 is a valid revision number! (Eg: the "wordpress" charm
is at revision 0 right now).

Merge pull request #14813 from benhoyt/juju-download-revision

https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/14813

This PR shows the revision number in the stderr output when running `juju download`, so you can cross-reference it with `juju info` output.

It also changes the default filename to include the revision number, for example from `mycharm_39ef98b.charm` (using `sha[:7]`) to `mycharm_r42.charm` (@hmlanigan's suggestion).

I found the lack of revision when using `juju download` made it harder to see what was going on when testing `juju info` and then `juju download` on a charm with multiple channels and arches. Also, it matches how we show revision during `juju deploy` (including `juju deploy --dry-run`).

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made
- [x] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing
- [ ] ~[Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
- [ ] ~[doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

```sh
# before
$ juju download ubuntu-advantage
Fetching charm "ubuntu-advantage" using "stable" channel and base "amd64/ubuntu/22.04"
Install the "ubuntu-advantage" charm with:
 juju deploy ./ubuntu-advantage_73b9262.charm

# after
$ juju download ubuntu-advantage
Fetching charm "ubuntu-advantage" revision 39 using "stable" channel and base "amd64/ubuntu/22.04"
Install the "ubuntu-advantage" charm with:
 juju deploy ./ubuntu-advantage_r39.charm
```

pull_request.title: Show revision during "juju download"; make default path include rN
pull_request.body:
This PR shows the revision number in the stderr output when running `juju download`, so you can cross-reference it with `juju info` output.

It also changes the default filename to include the revision number, for example from `mycharm_39ef98b.charm` (using `sha[:7]`) to `mycharm_r42.charm` (@hmlanigan's suggestion).

I found the lack of revision when using `juju download` made it harder to see what was going on when testing `juju info` and then `juju download` on a charm with multiple channels and arches. Also, it matches how we show revision during `juju deploy` (including `juju deploy --dry-run`).

## Checklist

- [x] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
- [x] Comments saying why design decisions were made
- [x] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing

# after
$ juju download ubuntu-advantage
Fetching charm "ubuntu-advantage" revision 39 using "stable" channel and base "amd64/ubuntu/22.04"
Install the "ubuntu-advantage" charm with:
    juju deploy ./ubuntu-advantage_r39.charm
```

issue.title: [Bug]: Unable to deploy by series/base on Juju 3.0
issue.body:
### Description

When using Juju 3.0, it's no longer possible to deploy by series/base.

From speaking with @wallyworld this morning, I think it's because in 3.0 the deploy API no longer accepts series, which is what we're passing [here](https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/blob/55690bb8e5659c4d7d856e94475350d194318989/juju/model.py#L2073). In 3.0 I believe we should be sending a "base"

### Urgency

Blocker for our release

### Python-libjuju version

3.0.3 and `master`

### Juju version

3.0

### Reproduce / Test

An example of this is can be seen in this [CI run](https://github.com/jnsgruk/parca-operator/actions/runs/3318649190/jobs/5482836881#step:4:98) when the code actually specifies the `jammy` series, python-libjuju actually deploys `focal`. My understanding is that the Juju 3.0 API is likely ignoring the series parameter (code [here](https://github.com/jnsgruk/parca-operator/pull/15/files#diff-08291d7f4ad7b2caecacb6ae26af540ebbaede9fe42d5e8e1b39d2bdefe4c2d4R43))

issue.title: [Bug]: Pass a 'series' kwarg to Model.deploy() error when series is specified
issue.body:
### Description

Hi,
All of our iur integration tests are failing in CI with the following error although the `series` parameter is specified when deploying.

`juju.errors.JujuError: Couldn't determine series for charm at /home/runner/work/indico-operator/indico-operator/.tox/integration/tmp/pytest/testing0/charms/indico_ubuntu-20.04-amd64.charm. Pass a 'series' kwarg to Model.deploy().`

If we pin the version to 3.0.2 the error isn't raised.
It look like this issue was introduced in this [PR](https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/746/files).

Also, it is my understanding that, given I'm deploying kubernetes charms, the series should be irrelevant.

Thank you

### Urgency

Annoying bug in our test suite

### Python-libjuju version

3.0.3

### Juju version

2.9.35

### Reproduce / Test

```python
# Deploy relations first to speed up overall execution
    hello_kubecon_app_name = "hello-kubecon"
    await ops_test.model.deploy(hello_kubecon_app_name)

    # Build and deploy ingress
    charm = await ops_test.build_charm(".")
    application = await ops_test.model.deploy(
        charm, application_name=app_name, series="focal", trust=True
    )
    await ops_test.model.wait_for_idle()
```
```

fixes #759

Merge pull request #761 from cderici/improve-resolve-charm

https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/761

#### Description

This fixes the latest issues related to the `series` information for both local and charmhub charms.

Fixes #758, #759 


#### QA Steps

To QA the #758, I downloaded the `hello-kubecon` and tried it with that, so following should work:

```python
await model.deploy('./hello-kubecon_ubuntu-20.04-amd64.charm', series='focal', trust=True)
```

And for the #759, I added that specific case as an integration test, so the following should work:

```
tox -e integration -- tests/integration/test_unit.py::test_unit_introspect
```

For everything else the current tests in the CI should pass.

issue.title: Using "echo -e" for juju-proxy.sh output to interpret escaped newlines
issue.body:
Use `echo -e` to interpret backslash escapes and put newlines into /etc/profile.d/juju-proxy.sh.

## Checklist

- [X] Code style: imports ordered, good names, simple structure, etc
~- [] Comments saying why design decisions were made~
- [X] Go unit tests, with comments saying what you're testing
~- [] [Integration tests](https://github.com/juju/juju/tree/develop/tests), with comments saying what you're testing~
~- [] [doc.go](https://discourse.charmhub.io/t/readme-in-packages/451) added or updated in changed packages~

## QA steps

Confirm there is no "command not found" output when doing `juju ssh` to a bootstrapped controller and that the content of /etc/profile.d/juju-proxy.sh is as desired.

Currently:

```
$ juju bootstrap lxd


$ juju ssh -m controller 0
[...]
n#: command not found


$ juju ssh -m controller 0 'cat /etc/profile.d/juju-proxy.sh'
\n# Added by juju\n[ -f "/etc/juju-proxy.conf" ] && . "/etc/juju-proxy.conf"\n
```

Desired:

```
$ juju bootstrap lxd


$ juju ssh -m controller 0
[no "command no found" error]


$ juju ssh -m controller 0 'cat /etc/profile.d/juju-proxy.sh'

# Added by juju
[ -f "/etc/juju-proxy.conf" ] && . "/etc/juju-proxy.conf"

```
